Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ddesk1
Reviews.Content: Always a great place to stay in Dallas. Very convenient to almost anywhere in Dallas. Hotel very accommodating. Great breakfast. Nice attitude all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: FRHrdrck
Reviews.Content: Decided to have a quick weekend getaway from Oklahoma City and decided to try Dallas and this hotel. Had a great time!! Checked in at 7:20p, front desk clerk made sure to tell us that the Manager's Reception would be over at 7:30p...lucky for us, we were the last ones in line. Discovered there was a volleyball tournament going on and teams were also staying in the hotel...not one problem with noise. Morning breakfast was excellent also. Had to make 1 call for an extra blanket, and they brought it up within 10 minutes. Didn't try the restaurant because we found other local places, but the stay overall was great. Would give this hotel 5 stars BUT they charge for wifi (who does that anymore?!) and, while trying to find the hotel from I35, the neighborhood is a little sketchy...not really bad, but just enough to make you wonder if you made a wrong turn.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like an Ambassador!”
Reviews.Author: Helen W
Reviews.Content: I stayed in ten different hotels last year and this was my favourite. Everything was excellent, the staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. The public area's were immaculately clean as were the rooms. The beds - extremely comfortable, the rooms in general were lovely. I particularly like Embassy Suites for their space and convenience but this particular hotel excelled in a chain I find superior already. The breakfasts were so good and so plentiful. It would be too easy to go away from here waddling! We also really enjoyed the managers reception in the evenings. I didn't expect the Margarita's to be as strong as they were which was a mistake I made only once! It might be complimentary but it's not *cheap*! With the shuttle to and from the airport and a restaurant serving delectable prime rib I didn't need or want to go anywhere but here during the course of our stay (for a convention) I would return every time I go to Dallas with pleasure and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: civility
Reviews.Content: This embassy suites hotel is located very close to Dallas Love Field and without traffic only about 10 minutes to SMU. Note that in rush hour it took us over half an hour to make the trip on the route indicated by the GPS, we later found out that there are other roads that may have been better. It is an atrium style hotel that I feel is in need of some renovation. I noticed upon check in that there was dirt dripping down the wallpaper in the office and that clued me in to some problems. The rooms are adequate but not attractive. Living room furniture is worn and outdated. The bed was very comfortable and the mattress looked new (I always check for bed bugs). The bathroom was spacious and I appreciated that they have magnifying mirrors, however, the lighting in the bathroom is very dim. Linens were good. Overall I feel that the every day cleaning in the room is very good but deep cleaning is needed. This is usually a result of management not allowing time in the schedule for cleaning beyond the normal turnover duties. The free breakfast was outstanding and included made to order omelets or eggs. The restaurant and housekeeping staff were very friendly and solicitous, however the front desk staff did not go beyond minimal politeness and when we asked for suggestions and directions they gave the impression of being inconvenienced by the question.

Reviews.Title: “close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: sudsdrinker
Reviews.Content: shuttle runs on the 1/2. food good, rooms small for embassy suites, seems older. average for this kind of hotel, a little dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: DKLT
Reviews.Content: Great place for families or a quiet weekend getaway. Rooms are nice- suites- beds are good/ free happy hour in the evening starting at 5:30 & cook to order FULL breakfast in the mornings are included. This location is our favorite & we have stayed here several times.

Reviews.Title: “Great perks and very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: JJESeattle_Wa
Reviews.Content: The managers happy hour is great every evening. The rooms are very clean, quiet and bedroom curtains allow room to be completely dark during the day, a bonus if your working nights. The pool is small and indoors. The gym is connected to the pool so it's quite warm and humid in there but plenty of cardio machines. This hotel is right next to Love field and I never heard airplane noise once while in my room.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: mkfore244
Reviews.Content: we got a huge corner room. We really liked the room very spacious. We also enjoyed the free breakfast it was awesome. Omelets were amazing and they had a free happy hour. The only thing that I did not like is that they charge you for internet usage. We went back to Dallas and didnt stay here because of that. For our purposes it was in a great location. A couple of miles west of northwest highway and really close to Love field.

Reviews.Title: “Kid friendly, kind employees, good location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: kristeninrr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was clean and the employees were very kind. I liked that we were able to park close to the entrance on all three days. The free breakfast was also delicious. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Average to good”
Reviews.Author: MSPilot
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels, 200 nights a year and I frequently stay at this hotel. This hotel is a good over all, however it has it's flaws. Some beds are good, some are not. My room recently had not been vacuumed and was filthy! The bathroom was clean and the bed was clean. It could have been a single event, but this seems to be happening with more frequency here. The sheets and covers seem to be ageing. Otherwise this is a typical Embassy hotel. It's quiet considering it's close to the airport and major hwy. The staff is friendly. The bar and restaurant is barely average but the bar staff does a great job. Some have complained about the free happy hour but come-on, it's free! What can you expect? I never rate a hotel based on whether on not the happy hour is good or not. That's just a plus. This happy hour is very average, just so you know, but my review is based on everything else in a broad spectrum. There is a Target that's walking distance and a couple fast food restaurants. It's close to Dallas Love Field. You can be at the Terminal in about 10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Masdks
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at an Embassy Suites and we really enjoyed it. The hotel is really nice and very well kept. We stayed here with our 2 young children (5 yrs and 20 months) who loved the water fountain in the lounge area and the view of the planes taking off from our window. We had a suite on the 8th floor which very spacious and away from all the noise as weekend we stayed here there was a cheer leading competition in Dallas, so the hotel was full of cheerleaders and it got a bit noisy at times. The hotel staff were very friendly and the breakfast was very good too. We had dinner in the restaurant the first night and the pizza was pretty good. The hotel is also in a great location with easy access to the major highways and plenty of stores and restaurants near by. The kids loved the pool and my daughter didn't want to leave. We would defiantly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Tom G
Reviews.Content: The overall appearance of the hotel is very nice on the inside. The rooms are well kept but the beds are really bad. When I sat on the edge of my bed, you could feel the springs coming thru the side. The evening happy hour is very basic, just drinks and chips (can get better at a Homewood Suite) but the breakfast was very good in the AM. Location was ok, a short drive to Dallas-Love field. Downtown was about 20 minutes or so without taking the toll road. Would I go back? Most likely no based on the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: texanrebel
Reviews.Content: Jessica, at the front desk made us feel so welcome, she was a pleasant person who made our stay as wonderful as possible! Very friendly staff. Love this hotel! We live in san marcos tx and our embassy suites is really nice and the staff are nice too but this one in dallas love field went above and beyond the professional kindness that could be provided.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smtietge
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites is quite possible the best deal in Dallas! We stayed here just to get away for the weekend and were completely blown away! The price ($99 + tax) per night for the room and the complimentary happy hour (drinks and snacks) and the complimentary cooked to order breakfast was AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Great for groups!”
Reviews.Author: annag5577
Reviews.Content: I was really blown away by this embassy suites. My expectations were greatly exceeded. I've always loved this hotel chain since I was a kid, just looking down into the atrium and riding the elevator with the windows was fun.....still is I guess! We were a very large group (200+) and I didn't think the staff would provided any sort of individual attention but they did, and they did it with a smile. The breakfast and dinner people were always friendly and the front staff was always helpful. The rooms were clean, a little dated but clean. Paper was delivered every morning. Breakfast is always great here and the managers happy hour or whatever it was called was an added touch BUT there was only one bartender working for all of us and he looked like he hated his life both nights. I understand why...but then again they maybe need to be prepared to have more staff. It is very close to downtown and Love Field and would fit those visiting the medical district very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: JimCon2011
Reviews.Content: Good location, great staff, consistent superior quality. Friendly staff with little turn over noticed over many visits. Always get a great free breakfast with a wonderful omelet chef. Bartender at the managerâ€™s reception always remembers you even if it has been several months since your last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Texhank
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice as most Embassy Suites are. Rooms were very comfortable, clean and complimentary breakfast was good. Managers reception was very nice. My only drawback was the restaurant. The food was not what I expected. I ordered a hamburger and waited quite a while for it with very few customers in the restaurant. Then I ordered my favorite desert, bread pudding. What came on the plate did not resemble any bread pudding I ever ordered before. It was a very dry chunk which is hard to describe, no moisture, no sauce and it kind of looked like a dry fruitcake without the fruit. It was a complete disappointment. I may be back but will not eat in the restaurant unless they make some changes.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Brenda P
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to Love Field made this our pick of hotels, but the pleasant experience will make it our #1 choice the next time we need a hotel in the area. The hotel and employees were tops in cleanliness and service. The made to order complimentary breakfast was so much better than the typical complimentary continental breakfasts at other hotels. The shuttle ride to the airport and back again was a real stress saver for me. Thanks for a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis P
Reviews.Content: Room was great; manager's reception great; and breakfast was too! Definitely would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “We always stay at the Love Field Hotel when we can”
Reviews.Author: bobby f
Reviews.Content: Great location ---great rooms----great food in the hotel and near by

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: blessed70508
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with spacious suites and comfortable beds. The room and hotel itself was very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. They provide an awesome breakfast with made to order omelets and every other thing you could imagine- FREE. They also have a free cocktail hour which I missed. Free parking is a plus as is the location which was easy to find and close to everything I needed. I ordered room service which was good and very fast. All in all this is a winner and I definitely plan on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: BobbyD66
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price. Location is okay about 45 min from DFW ( in Texas everything is about an hour away!)Only problem is no airport shuttle. Staff was very friendly and rooms were large and clean. Hotel food is expensive ( I spent $140 for lunch for 3 Ouch!) Ask front desk for shuttle to local eating joints! Shuttle driver is a great guy and knows best places to eat. Overall a good stay. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are traveling to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: travelnow39
Reviews.Content: If you are flying out of Love Field, I find this is a great hotel option. I have stayed here numerous times for business and personal purposes. Free shuttle to and from Love Field, underground parking and good meeting areas. I fly out early mornings, so I can come in the night before and not worry about parking headaches. The staff has always been freindly and helpful. They do need a remodel, but I found everything to be clean and working properly.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, Wi-Fi policy a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Kims0304
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable and spacious, but it was dated and could use a spruce. It was clean enough, but did not feel fresh. The breakfast was good, but the hotel being open in the middle, does mean that in the evening, loud patrons enjoying a drink can keep you up. The central air is also loud. So loud that it made it hard to fall asleep. While I would give the room 3 stars, I'm deducting points for their Wi-Fi, which is pricy and slow. If small B&Bs can provide free Wi-Fi, so should a business hotel. They charged double for the Wi-Fi, because I connected from different devices: my laptop and phone. What business traveler only connects from one device these days? Pure rip-off! The hotel charged $12 for a local phone call. When I complained, the lady at the front desk said nothing, and then just handed over a new bill. When I checked in with quite a lot of luggage, no one offered to help or even bring a trolley. The waiter in the bar area was curt too. In fact most of the staff looked miserable, overworked and just wasn't helpful. It doesn't do well as a business hotel, but feels too much like a business hotel for family vacations. Unless work decided for me, I wouldn't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: pfturner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a few of the Embassy Suites in the North Dallas area, and I can say that this one is the most disappointing. First, I am a Hilton Diamond VIP, and there were no water bottles or anything complimentary in the room at all. Second, I could not regulate the water in the shower. It would go from lukewarm to scalding and back in a matter of seconds. It make for an interesting shower! I complained to the front desk, and they said it was fixed, but the next day I had the same thing. Third, the breakfast was not as complete as the other Embassy Suites in the area. The others have hot dishes in addition to the made-to-order area. This one just had continental items. While the room was ok overall, I will not be back. There are much better places to stay. And a future reservation I had for this hotel was cancelled.

Reviews.Title: “Problems Seem Corrected”
Reviews.Author: ljgok
Reviews.Content: After a four day stay at this hotel on a very busy weekend I did not find any of the recent reported problems especially with reception staff. Everyone was courteous and efficient. The wireless was 5 bars whenever I used it in the living area of the suite. Cocktail reception and breakfast standard ES. Hilton corporate coffeemakers in room still are inadequate and worse as they age.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not good for business, has potential”
Reviews.Author: fdipace
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for accessing Dallas sites and businesses however if you need to work while here the Internet connection is slow and erratic dropping connections often. As a diamond member I was upgraded (a first for a Hilton property) to a larger suite which had a huge bathroom with a large tub. Unfortunately the elevator decided to stop working on the way to the room so I was stuck for a while until it decided to resume working. I tried to call the front desk but they just put me on hold and never answered. Although being suites the furniture and TV's could stand to be upgraded. Flat screens would be welcome. Central A/C works great but you cannot set a certain temperature. I usually stay at the Sheraton Suites a few blocks away although they charge for parking and the A/C stinks the room is modern and the hotel has a lounge. A weird design of the Embassy Suites is the massive A/C fans outside your window, they make a lot of noise. I can see how light sleepers would find this annoying. On the plus side of this hotel is the breakfast and afternoon reception with free beer, etc. Overall OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: HoustonWahine
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week due to my husband being in a training class in Dallas. Hotel was clean, service was good, and location was great! Breakfast service had a great variety and as was mentioned by another reviewer, it was fully stocked right till the end of the morning. Staff is very personable and efficient. On a Tuesday morning, the lady preparing omelets was alone, no one assisting her, and the line was very, very long. She just kept smiling, greeted each person, took their order, and proceeded to do this until every last one was done. Her omelets were great and she had such a sweet disposition. One morning I forgot my travel coffee cup on the table and when I went down to see if they had it, one of the bus boys said he saw that I forgot it and had set it aside for me, kmowing I would be back for it. Overall, a great hotel, right next to Love Field, close to Lake Bachman if you want to go for a jog/run, NorthPark Mall is a few miles east, along with great restaurants and access to several highways.

Reviews.Title: “Not a business class hotel. Internet performance is unusable.”
Reviews.Author: mikecohn
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. The internet is completely unusable if you are here for business. I ran speakeasy.net speed tests a number of times. Average download were 0.37 Mbps per second. Average upload was 0.18 Mbps. That is unusable. Room service was an equally frustrating experience. I called the number a few times and kept getting a recording. And not one that started with "This is room service..." It was "Suite Services," which could be anything. After a few attempts I had the front desk transfer me in case I was getting the wrong place. Nope. They just apparently have one person who works room service and she was out making a delivery so she can't take the next order. About 15' after my initial call, room service called back and offered to take my order. By then I'd given up and ordered a pizza for delivery from Papa John's. Admittedly the manager did call me and offer me free wings for the inconvenience. I don't want or expect anything free. But I do expect the things I'm paying for. A further sample of how bad this place is: There's a gift basket on my desk when I check in. (Probably because I'm a frequent Hilton guest.) It says, "here's a salty snack (pretzels) and two sweet ones (candy bars)." There's only one candy bar in the basket. I wasn't going to eat either one but don't tell me there are two of something and only put one in the basket. Positives: The hotel staff are all friendly but I think that's more a Texas thing than this hotel as I would have said the same about staff at a different Texas hotel last week. The room seems clean and the desk (table) is good for getting some work done. My client has insisted I stay here but I'm checking out and going to the Hotel Palomar (I know Kimpton's to always be nice hotels). It's further and I'll have to pay for it myself rather than bill them but that's how bad this place really is. If you're here for a family trip and just need a place to crash at night, it's probably fine and cheap. If you need to do any work and want the convenience of room service (and the necessity of internet access at tolerable speeds) then don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: Rbmccau
Reviews.Content: The girls at the front desk were helpful. The suite was roomy and clean. Made to order omelettes werr nice. Location is close to airport. Shuttle every half hour. I will stay hrre again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Love Field Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: bohste
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Embassy Suites quite a few times over the years. This was undoubtedly the worst visit. When I checked in the counter clerk was unfriendly and seemed almost offended that I was bothering her at check-in. The room was okay (they actually upgraded the TV's), but it was a little warm because of the hot temperatures that Dallas was having. When I woke up on Saturday morning they had a power outage. I called the front desk and asked if she knew if this was going to be a long outage. She was extremely rude to someone who spends more than 60 nights at the Hilton family of hotels annually. I took a shower in the dark (at least I had hot water), but the maid didn't leave any shampoo in the room. I went downstairs and they had very little to eat - not of it hot. I thought this was okay so I went to get a bowl of cereal and they had no milk. Of course, they were out of coffee. When I checked out on Sunday it was still the same old poor attitude ... no thanks for staying ... no apology that there was a power outage ... it was like "don't let the door hit you in the axx" I don't know if I'll ever go back to this Embassy Suites. Like I said I've stayed here over the years, but this one instance was enough to get me to think about staying somewhere else in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Spent the Weekend with my Grandkids and had a wonderful time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fayebird
Reviews.Content: I met my grandkids at this hotel for a weekend visit. My grandson are 12 and 14, my granddaughter is 21, and my great-grandson is 3-1/2, and we had such a good time. The boys were not bored, which is very unusual for them, and we all especially enjoyed the made to order breakfast both mornings we were there. The indoor pool, along with the sauna, hot tub, and steam room were all great! The king suite was huge with a king bed in one room and in the other room, there was a sofa bed, occasional chair, and dining room table with 4 chairs. We did not feel cooped up at all. Of course, there are flat screen TV's in each room, a small bar with a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot.

Reviews.Title: “Baby-friendly stay and awesome amenities!”
Reviews.Author: gloopy21
Reviews.Content: Baby friendly stay! The suite bedroom door closed so baby could sleep in the pack 'n play while mom and dad watched some TV. The bathtub housed baby nicely (a little slippery though). The hotel seemed to have sound-proofed the rooms so baby couldn't hear the neighbors, and I don't think the neighbors heard baby. The room setup kept baby out of trouble too. Little guy can crawl and stand and could only get in trouble with trash cans and one telephone cord (both easily fixed). Also, the lounge area where the hotel serves complimentary drinks/snacks worked nicely to feed our 10 month oldâ€”the staff even provided a high chair outside of happy hour/breakfast time. For non-baby related amenities, the hotel provides nice workout equipment (weight bench, dumbbells up to 50 lbs and treadmills). The only downside to working out is you have to walk through a very wet pool area to get to the workout room. The hotel even enforced the â€œ18 and overâ€� policy for the workout room when some teens wandered in. Embassy Suites Love Field also offered a free Gold's Gym day pass with complimentary shuttle ride to gym. Even though the hotel offered free gym passes, drinks and breakfast, Internet access will cost you $9.95 for 24 hrs Bummer. Final wordâ€”great price, great amenities and baby-approved with pay-for-use Internet as the only minor turn-off.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no issues, no planes heard !”
Reviews.Author: flabeachfan
Reviews.Content: Alittle concerned with possible noise from the airport (could actually SEE the runway at Lov Field from our room), but never heard anything....well, other than loud guests at 2 am in nearby rooms. And the guests in ALL hotels seem to get loud on weekends at 2 am, door slams, loud voices in rooms, so not sure the Hotel could do much about that. The rooms have windows to the interior, which is a Embassy Suites thing. If you were staying on an extended trip, perhaps that would give more than 4 walls in a hotel feel, perhaps. Room was clean, no issues at all. Breakfast offered hot, to order, type items as well as cold cererals, yogurt, fruits, juices, coffee etc. Food was good, not outstanding, just sorta what you find at Embassy Suites. Pool was just ok. Steam room and dry saunas closer to not working, than fully functional...hot tub was similar with only one jet blowing. Overall experience would be ok, but nothing exceptional. Didn't have much interaction with staff.

Reviews.Title: “Want to watch planes and have a great hotel room?”
Reviews.Author: willworkforhotelroom
Reviews.Content: A new addition to the Love Field area, this new Embassy Suites knocked the concept of the hotel room out of the park. As a newbie to suite-style rooms, I was blown by the additional area afforded through booking a suite. It also didn't hurt that this was a very new hotel, with an excellent lounge area [think large plush couches, a grand piano, ample seating], and conveniently located next to Love Field. The room was equipped very well, with an LG TV in the bedroom area AND the living room area. With a desk in the living room part of the suite, a fridge, and a microwave, you are set for all your business and culinary needs. Particularly impressive for me was that the sofa in the living room area, which converted to a sleeper sofa. We had someone join us for one night [moving the number of people in our room from 4 to 5] and we didn't even have to ask for a rollaway bed! Of course, the crowning star of any Embassy Suites is the AMAZING breakfast spread that they offer. Omelettes? Why, yes please. Fresh watermelon and canteloupe? Of course. Chopped pecans and walnuts? Sure thing. I was particularly impressed with this ES since the spread was kept at maximum even towards the end of the breakfast period. They also offered a reception in the evening with tea/coffee and light snacks. What would have made this a perfect hotel stay would be better (i.e. ACTUAL) pillows and free internet access. It's not just ES; I've noticed other hotels switching to the "square" pillow format, which has to be sort of "lengthened" out if you want an average size albeit incredibly smushy pillow. Luckily, I'm not a pillow fiend, so it didn't detract too much from my experience but it did so for others. Also, the internet situation is awful at this place. Who *doesn't?* offer free Wi-Fi anymore? Even an America's Best Value offers free internet. If you try using the business room, good luck using the internet. Either it's still dial-up or they've decided to add some retro style and use dial-up speed internet. While access to a printer is nice, I'd like to print the page sometime within the year. That being said, the staff is extremely friendly and very helpful, both in taking care of room-related inquiries and pointing you out to restaurants, giving you directions, etc. There is a also a gift shop in the lobby (that also sells stamps!) if you're yenning to send a postcard to a friend. If you're in the Love Field area, this is a great place to stay. Since they're new, they're also offering great deals :) Take advantage!

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality & Value”
Reviews.Author: eplawyer
Reviews.Content: Close to Love Field; but, tucked away in a nice green belt. We stayed up on the seventh floor and had a view out over the tree line. Very nice park trail down below that goes out by Bachman Creek. Our suite was in great shape and we were very pleased with the room and the amenities. Then, you have a cooked to order breakfast with all the sides available every morning. In the evening you have the Manager's Reception which is chips and dips; but, a nice bartender that can whip up your drink request. All of the breakfasts and evening receptions are included in your daily rate. I believe the quality to value ratio is very hard to beat especially if you book an advance reservation

Reviews.Title: “Terrible-Room smelled like mold.”
Reviews.Author: Valerie77
Reviews.Content: Was in Dallas for one night for a medical oral board certification exam. Was reserved at another hotel, which overbooked and bounced us to here- but that's another story. This hotel is dreadful. The location is totally lame--very suburban, and there is nothing but strip malls (many of which are not fully occupied) around, so if you don't have a car, you are stuck in this dreary hotel. Speaking of stuck, the decor is that bad 80's stuff. The room was very cold- the thermostat was set at 55 degrees when I arrived (a colleague noted the same in his room). The room smelled like mold. I opted not to try to switch rooms, as I figured it was not an isolated situation. Another colleague noted the same in her room (so I was right). The layout of the room was good, and it was a good space for me to lay out my papers and laptop for last-minute studying. But I felt like I was in a cave, and sensed that I, too, smelled like mold when I left the room. If it weren't for the staff, i would have given only 1 star. They were all very friendly and accomodating, and seem to genuinely want to provide great service. Oh, the fitness room was above average. Sometimes they seem to be an afterthought, but there were several cardio machines and a weight/stretch area, adjacent to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for SMU visit”
Reviews.Author: TRAVSFGTK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for visits to SMU. They provide very courteous and convenient shuttle drop off and pick up. The hotel staff was friendly and were able to have a room ready for us by 10:30am due to our early arrival. The corporate rate for the room was excellent. Breakfasts included were very good. Room was quite adequate although could have used a touch of updating and improved interior lighting. The indoor pool was warm and excellent for swimming laps. Parking was free and underground--another plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot!”
Reviews.Author: mainetoday
Reviews.Content: I found this place on TripAdvisor and what is mentioned is very true. Great location and rooms were spacious and clean. Used the fitness center one morning and checked out the Steam Room in the adjacent pool area. Went and had the omelet to order breakfast in the Am and the staff was very friendly as well. All in all, if you are in town for a night or two on business or pleasure or just passing through, this is definately a clean and safe place to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and wonderful Town”
Reviews.Author: Stephens60
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with a wonderful group of staff and the views are amazing along with the breakfast and the area this hotel is around. I was in town to site see and this hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, clean, and service was prompt when more pillows were needed!”
Reviews.Author: Eroni
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great-close to many fun places to go, close to the airport, and a comfortable bed with nice linens! Parking is all in front and very accessible, and the staff was very friendly. Also, this hotel is kid friendly, however, we never heard any disturbances and the room was quiet and comfortable. This Embassy Suites also has a little snack hour around 6:00 p.m. which is nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: aficionado56797
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter (age 7), and I came to Dallas for a leisure/educational spring break. Principally, we planed to visit the Arboretum, the Dallas Museum of Art (including Nasher), the World Aquarium, and the Dallas Zoo. I wanted nice amenities, safety, and a central location, all within a reasonable price range. This Embassy Suite fit my needs exceptionally well. When you factored in the fact that you don't have to pay for valet parking (like alot of hotels in downtown Dallas), and you get a quality breakfast (cooked to order, not a cold cereal / danish bar) the quality vs economy was very well balanced. The room was spacious, with two TV's, so my wife could watch the season final of The Bachelor in the sitting room, while my daughter watched Nickelodeon in the bedroom. The mini frig. and microwave were a plus, as was the indoor pool. And while I could actually look out our bedroom window and watch departing jet traffic from Dallas Love Field, I found our room exceptionaly quiet. I found the staff to be engaging, the facilities to be pleasing, and the room accommodating. I have stayed at Hotels in Dallas before, only $30.00 to $40.00 dollars cheaper per night , where you were not certain your car was still going to be there in the morning. When you factor in the cost of a comparable breakfast for two adults and one child at a IHOP, your net gain of staying at a cheap hotel is near zero. My family and I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience combined with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jerusalembarbara
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I were lecturing in Dallas, and found the location excellent, the service excellent and the room comfortable. We particularly liked the pool, open late for post-lecture debriefing and relaxing.. My only complaints are the lack of free high speed internet and a round-the-clock coffee pot, a feature you get in the Hamptons.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again and again.”
Reviews.Author: guitar_rockin
Reviews.Content: Our trip was for a little weekend getaway in Dallas. We stayed here for 3 nights. I'm very picky when it comes to choosing a hotel, and I was not disappointed. It is located in a good area of town, I would feel safe taking a walk around the area of the hotel. We parked in the parking garage under the hotel which I liked, felt my vehicle was very safe. They have a security guard inside the hotel overnight. It was located closer to most things in Dallas than I thought it would be. Only 10 minutes to the Galleria or 10 minutes to downtown Dallas(depending on traffic of coure, we traveled at non peak times), only took about 20 minutes to get to Pete's in Addison. We originally got a room on the 2nd floor and we like to stay on high floors, they were happy to put us on the 6th floor. The rooms are spacious and plenty big enough for the two of us. Something important to every traveler, the rooms were very clean, bathroom was very clean as well as the bedding. I found the top off of a deoderant stick under the bed when leaving the room, but no biggie. Roomservice did a good job and provided turndown service and towels everyday. My two favorite things about this hotel, the breakfast and manager's reception. The breakfast is great, best I have ever had in a hotel. We never really needed to eat lunch because of the big breakfast. Omlelets made to order, eggs, potatoes, hotcakes, sausage, bacon, yum! Plus having the typical cereal, fruit, yougert available. The manager's reception serves free beer, wine, and mixed drinks from 5:30-7:30 every night in the Atrium. Sunday night for some reason it was served in the bar. The selection is a bit limited but you can get most drinks you want, but it's not a free full bar. They mostly serve cheper acohol, but for free I didn't complain. My girlfriend said it was one of the best margritas she every had, and thats her drink of choice, I stuck to Jim Beem and coke. We did drink at the bar one evening, and the bartender was friendly and drink prices were on par with most other places. Overall we loved our stay!! Three things that could have been better but are not deal breakers 1. The bed was confortable but could have been better, I've had those pillow top beds at hotels priced the same as this one that were extremely comfortable, if this hotel had those it would have been perfect. 2. Might be personal preference, but I like having a fan in the bathroom and non fogging mirror, didn't have either 3. You have to pay for internet access, $10 for a day, internet should be provided for free! And there are no free wireless connections in rage of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: smileysara
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was for my husband's Holiday Party on January 9, 2011. The breakfast at this hotel was great. It was a buffet and a wide variety of food. Also, our group was coming back to the hotel at 11:00 p.m. from the party and the bar was closing up but the bartender was great and stayed until 1:00 a.m. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: ShazaamIam
Reviews.Content: We planned a quick overnight trip to Dallas and wanted to stay somewhat close to Dallas Love Field. Based upon Trip Advisor ratings, we decided to take a chance on this hotel. It was absolutely perfect for our needs. Free parking, good location (no, you don't hear the airplanes nearby) and good value for the price. We were warmly greeted upon arrival. Because all rooms are suites, I expected them to be small, but both rooms were very large. Bathroom was very clean--a BIG dealbreaker for me. We didn't go to the Manager's Reception, but the hot breakfast the next morning was very good. Upon our return home, I discovered that I'd left something in my room. One phone call to them and it was found and mailed to my home. This is my new Dallas hotel on all future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully pleasant, clean, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Steiner13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a couple of friends that travel to Dallas frequently becuase of its location by Love field, and also because of its staf and awesome breakfast omeletes. Of course we also liked the free managers happy hour with a full bar. But the staff really was friendly and genuinely helpful in every encounter. I guess the only thing that we could say we didnt like is that some of the furniture in the lobby is a little dated and worn, though not too bad. But our suite was perfect, nice furnishings, good water pressure (a pet peeve of my husband) and plenty of space. we recommedn this place and will defintiely come back there in our next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Senthilnatha
Reviews.Content: We had to stay somewhere for a week between two weekend events we were in Dallas for. We chose this place after reading other reviews here. It really delivered. Despite it's proximity to the Love Field runways, we never heard a single plane take off. It is so quiet. Excellent place for professionals.

Reviews.Title: “Has everything a business traveler might want or need.”
Reviews.Author: boatmisser
Reviews.Content: The employees are very courteous, friendly, and helpful. Breakfast and the manager's reception are great ways to start and end the day. Shuttle service to and from Love Field is timely and regular. A jogging trail that begins at the hotel goes under the busy streets and circles nearby Bachman Lake, which is a great place to walk or jog. This hotel differs from a typical Embassy Suites in that it seems to cater and appeal more to business travelers than families with a bunch of kids, so it is much quieter than one might expect. The exercise room is a bit cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: titusnike47
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with nice, updated rooms. Decent sized area for breakfast and happy hour. The restaurant in the hotel is ok, but there's a number of better restaurants nearby. Plenty of (free) parking in the lot outside. They charge for internet access unless you have Gold or Platinum Hilton status, which is a annoying.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service&accomodation”
Reviews.Author: malcolm12
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms,separate bedroom.Hotel staff friendly&helpful.My son&I were going to the Cowboys game& paid for the hotel van for transport to the game as did several others.Really appreciated the managers drinks&snacks each nt.{free}.Also the free breakfast was excellent..No complaint about this hotel{even had a indoor pool&gym}.

Reviews.Title: “Most accommodating staff I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: WAM1653
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our son, daughter-in-law and 4 year old granddaughter. We were very late getting in after an all day travel nightmare and none of us had anything substantial to eat all day. Since our flight departing Miami had us arriving at Dallas Love Field after 10:30 p.m. I called ahead to the hotel and arranged to have food waiting upon our arrival so that our granddaughter would not have to go to bed without dinner. The staff were very accommodating and went out or their way to insure we had a great meal waiting in our rooms for us when we arrived. The front desk representative was incredibly pleasant and checked us in quickly and efficiently. I would highly recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired and dirty”
Reviews.Author: bigape100
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the second time at the Embassy Suites Love Field. Great location and staff is friendly, but the hotel is dirty, tired and old. Hairs in sink, dusty room, grimmy walls and floors, and the style is alike a throw back to the 80's. I am sure it was very nice then. Please renovate soon and clean it up! But nice gardens outside.

Reviews.Title: “Perfrect if you're doing business near Love Field”
Reviews.Author: FJS34
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel for the last couple of years for my Dallas business trips. It is a great location, pretty centrally located to areas like Addison and downtown. The hotel itself is OK, the rooms aren't the most up to date but they do the job. The staff is pretty friendly. Also this is a place where a lot of people stay at for the Cowboy games. It's pretty fun to see people hanging their team's jerseys outside their windows...makes for a lively happy hour as well. Anyhow if you're looking for a comfortable place to operate in and out of for Dallas business this is a great place. I just wish the Embassy Suites would quit being cheap and STOP CHARGING FOR INTERNET USAGE!

Reviews.Title: “A Pilots Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jetjouster
Reviews.Content: We fly 2 private jets for a company and stay almost exclusively at Hilton's and Embassy's. When going to Dallas, we always stay at the Love Field property. Very close to a number of restaurants, and close to access to all of Dallas. The staff at Embassy has always been above average, professional and always taken care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: AgentSolitude
Reviews.Content: When my colleagues and I arrived in our large group, the general manger came out to greet us and informed us of their amenities which includes drinks on them during the afternoons and cook to order breakfast in the morning. They also have a wonderful hot tub/jacuzzi to de-stress in after a long day. I only wish my stay was longer to enjoy their amenities. Unfortunately, I did not get a chance to try out their tiramisu. Their strawberries, however, are delicious according to my colleague. Definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Embassy Suites Dallas Love Field is a Great Second Home”
Reviews.Author: Grady85
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular guest at the Embassy Suites, Dallas Love Field, for close to 6 years, as I commuted between a home in Houston to a job in Dallas, which just happened to be in one of the office towers next door. Since I began my stays back in July of 2004, the hotel and the team of professionals that work there have become my second home and family and any frequent traveler couldn't ask for better of either. The location is convenient to Love Field and DFW, the rooms have been recently remodeled, providing all of the comforts of home, the quality of the restaurant and lounge made it possible for me to rarely stray out of the hotel. Most importantly, all the staff at every level is committed to your total comfort and satisfaction and will always make you feel at home whether it is your first or your 200th stay. Take it from a Embassy Suites adopted family member, there isn't a better hotel in Dallas to stay with that will provide you the same total hospitality package. PS. Bring your fishing pole and try your luck on Bachman Creek, which borders the hotel green space.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: heyyou445667
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and wonderfully accommodating. It is clear that the hotel and staff work to make guests comfortable and well fed!

Reviews.Title: “imprssive recovery”
Reviews.Author: austintraveler52
Reviews.Content: I wrote a few days ago about the bad service at this hotel. A staff member got in touch with me about the problems I experienced. He adjusted the bill to accomodate the problems. Impressive recovery. So I rank it better now than right after my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: shellbo2
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel late and had to leave out on a flight very early. The staff was very nice and since their shuttle to the airport didn't run as early as we needed it to, they paid for a taxi to take us to the airport. Would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: brendy71
Reviews.Content: Me and my famiy went to Dallasa for a vacation and we stayed at the Embassy. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful and the made to order breakfast was wonderful. We had fun in the pool and the sauna was very relaxing. Would stay again if ever that way.

Reviews.Title: “The that I had was more than I had expected”
Reviews.Author: travler19
Reviews.Content: I was stayed at your Hotel on April 23rd and April 24th and I come up there several times a year and stayed at other fine quality Hotel and suites and when I stayed at the "Embassy Suites" I found that it was the best ever and the staff treated me as family and the rooms were so very clean as if I was at home and if I called from my room for any problem they would give it their personal attention as if I was the only one staying there and if I was traveling any where in the world I would request and book the "Embassy Suites" and this is my Hotel that I am becoming a family with and never again I want to stay at any other Hotel establishment because your my family family to me and my wife. Donald J. McClain

Reviews.Title: “Great,Just like being at home.”
Reviews.Author: kicirtap
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, where I'm very confortable and feel very safe. I'v been traveling for 32 years and this has been my most enjoyable experience. The only thing I would change is to have a little more variety of snacks at Happy Hour. Also, I think the price of sandwiches, hamburgers, fries, etc. should be a little less expensive at Happy Hour. Paying $11.00 plus tip is a little expensive. By the way I think Sharnetta wonderful person and a great employee. So are the rest of the front desk pepple

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Zell
Reviews.Content: Pending Review â€œA wonderful experienceâ€� Embassy Suites Hotel Dallas - Love Field Zell 67 contributions San Antonio, TX We recently stayed 2 nights at the Embassy Suites-Love Field. It is by far one of the best Embassy Suites we've stayed in... and we've stayed in numerous ones all over the U.S. The suite we were assigned was exactly as we requested, i.e. floor with view of city; everything was immaculately clean, the decor was beautiful throughout the hotel. What really impressed me was that ALL the staff we encountered (even those just passing in the corridor) had a smile on their face and greeted us! During the breakfast period, when the seating area started filling up, a manager immediately opened the seating in the adjacent restaurant to provide extra seating. I especially like the fact that the breakfast was served until 10:30 AM on weekends when so often it stops at 10 AM. Initially I had been concerned that since this hotel is so close to Love Field, we might be able to hear flight noise from the airport. This did not prove to be the case at all. Perhaps it is not in a flight pattern...or perhaps the hotel has good sound proofing. The physical location of the hotel is in an upscale residential and office park environment, something you also don't encounter. There are a number of good restaurants in the area as well. We will definitely make this our hotel of choice when we are in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great value.”
Reviews.Author: RJC1967
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot on business and stay in 3-4 star hotels all the time. Really liked this Embassy Suites and would recommend it to anyone. Great value and quality for a family of 5, the kids loved it. Room was clean, roomy and quiet and the bed was firm but soft enough. The atrium is appealling and the complimentary breakfast was a cut above most others that I have experienced. The indoor pool and hot tub were working and enjoyable, although the exercise room leaves a little to be desired. Only thing on my "wish list" for this hotel would be to have a second elevator so you didn't have to wal so far from the far side of the building - but that's being pretty picky.

Reviews.Title: “The service is personal, welcoming and professional. My business is appreciated.”
Reviews.Author: Legatuml
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel consistently since 1992. The staff teats me as an honored guest at all times. They are personally accommodating and very cordial at all times. There attitude is always friendly and I am greeted with a genuine smile. I am a good customer and they always treat me like they appreciate my business. That keeps me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BrendaKaye52
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Embassy Suites was wonderful. I enjoy the breakfast and cocktails served. The staff is always friendly and helpful. Will stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Hotel Dallas - Love Field is First Class!”
Reviews.Author: TOSPearland
Reviews.Content: As always, my 2 night stay at the Embassy Suites Hotel was top notch. The service provided by the staff made me feel like I was the most important guest staying at the hotel. The meals are always delicious regardless if it's breakfast, lunch or dinner. The overall cleanliness of the hotel and my room always exceeeds my expections. There is no other place I'd rather stay when traveling than at the Embassy!

Reviews.Title: “First-rate facility with consistently first-rate service.”
Reviews.Author: Barneybil
Reviews.Content: An excellent location near Love field with free sheltered parking, and a professional, responsive staff. We have someone staying there 5 or 6 times a year and have yet to have a complaint. A stroll along the lake behind the hotel is a nice way to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chgocutie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here during the All-Star Game, and I have to say, this was by far one of the better Embassy Suites we've stayed in....and we've stayed in a few. It is about 5 minutes away from Dallas-Love Field and they have a complimentary shuttle that will pick you up and take you to the hotel...or to the mall...or anywhere for that matter. Simply stop by the front desk and ask them nicely to take you to your destination, and they will do it! When you're ready to be picked up, a call to the hotel is all it takes. The room, an executive suite, complete with a soaking tub, was wonderful. There was a strange odor on the first day (the best way I can describe it was that it smelled "old"), but after placing a call to the front desk, the smell was eliminated almost immediately. Plenty of closet space, water pressure was good, and we had a nice view of the forest and creek below, along with the downtown Dallas skyline. Very serene. No trip is absolutely perfect, as my partner and I found out. We had a situation whereas we were at the Galleria Mall waiting to be picked up by the shuttle. Apparently the shuttle was side-swiped by another driver, so instead of having us wait in the cold, Jessica (the front office manager) asked us to take a cab back and the hotel would pay for it! We will definitely be staying here again. The staff truly made it worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Spent New Year's at the Embassy Suites and had a fantastic time, as expected...”
Reviews.Author: bchoate
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites on NW HWY is the perfect hotel for business travelers or a relaxing vacation get away. Conveniently located, and may amenities, including cook to order breakfast and managers reception each evening. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience in every way.”
Reviews.Author: KunoDallas
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for a Christmas Party for the Autism Society of Dallas. We had over 350 guests and Embassy Suites opened two additional rooms for us and it worked beautifullly. They took care of decorations, set up, food, entertainment equipment, etc. with extreme skill. I had so many comments on the professional service and friendly atmosphere. I couldn't leave out the wonderful food buffet the chef created. I plan to have this event there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome accomodations and service. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: pccc-dallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for leisure because was close to many events. Hotel was extremely clean and excellent service, with good food. The staff was exceptionally kind and helpful. We took advantage of the amenities, such as the pool and fitness center. I recommend for fun or business.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding in all aspects !”
Reviews.Author: dougwaldman
Reviews.Content: as above. i really liked everything, and it was so close to the airport, which was great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Embassy Suites I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: LonParadise_TX
Reviews.Content: From the cleanliness to the quality to the service to the location....everything is top=notch!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kesha33
Reviews.Content: Being my 5th wedding anniversay my husband and I really enjoyed the stay, as well as the atomsphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: NWTraveler75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is always my choice when staing in the Dallas area for several reasons. Proximity to my customer at Love Field, and the amazing staff, make it the place to stay for me. I've been coming here for years and with the recent room upgrades, the hotel is by far the best value in the area. The staff knows me by my first name and truly makes me feel at home when I'm on the road. In all my travels this hotel is certainly at the top of my list for value and friendliness!!

Reviews.Title: “I am made to feel special when I'm here.”
Reviews.Author: hightech057
Reviews.Content: Great staff, good food and excelent service. Everyone is very friendly with an upbeat attitude.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic; a great value”
Reviews.Author: bobby_stewart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels in all of Dallas. Staff is friendly, courteous, and attentive. Very professional. Rooms are clean. Breakfast is all that you could want with lots of choices, hot or cold, and a great eating area. The property has ample parking, including an underground parking garage which is great when the weather is nasty. The location is central to all areas of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Our Longhorn tradition @ OU weekend”
Reviews.Author: Offandrunnin
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Embassy Suites - Love Field for several years. Each year we return because there's no better place to stay! The manager's reception is enjoyable, the fantastic breakfast and dinner offerings are great. Why bother staying anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Embassy at Love Field shows their love!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingF0rBusiness
Reviews.Content: You will not be sorry if you stay at the Embassy Suites Love Field in Dallas, TX. Customer service is better here than any hotel I have stayed at. I spend approximately four months out of the year at this hotel and it feels like home. The employees know me by name. I consider them friends and family. Breakfast is great! The omelets are made to order and are the best omelets you will ever eat. The front desk staff are friendly and efficent. The dining room and bar staff are the best! Food is great! Management makes certain that everything about your stay is wonderful. I absolutely love this place!! Try it, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SRVFAN4EVR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites/Love Field hotel this past weekend for a quick getaway. We love this hotel. We have stayed here many times in the past & it always lives up to our expectations. For this visit, the view out of our window overlooked acres of beautiful trees, making us feel like we weren't in the middle of a large city, but out in the country. The rooms are large, neatly decorated & spotless! It's a quiet hotel and that makes relaxing easy. The hotel was so quiet that we slept right thru the complimentary breakfast service! The staff is polite, professional & always ready to assist with any need, they got us drinks, since we had missed breakfast. We sat in the large atrium area the morning we had to leave, talking about how beautiful the hotel was, there are fountains, statues & live plants everywhere. I feel comfortable recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stump3434
Reviews.Content: This location is very well located. I am greeted by first name when I return to visit. The food on the line is always fresh and the rooms are very clean. Billy Driscoll (--)

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Accomidating”
Reviews.Author: Kvon
Reviews.Content: We had a great visit, everyone was so nice from Front Desk, Room Service and staff around the bar area. Sure make a long day at work finish off really nice! Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL SUITE FELT LIKE HOME”
Reviews.Author: mrsdld
Reviews.Content: Flew in to Dallas to visit family in Louisiana - My husband and I wanted to stay at a hotel near an airport so it wouldn't be a rush on departure day. When I found out there was an Embassy Suites near an airport, I did not hesitate to reserved it for two days. I didn't even search around for other hotels. Our experience with this chain has been nothing but excellent. We stayed at one when we vacationed in Florida. We just loved the two-room spacious suite. It is so comfortable and very clean. Each room has a flat screen TV. It also has a wet bar and spacious countertop in the bathroom. We had a king size bed, which made it hard for us to get up. It's that comfortable. We love the made-to-order breakfast in an open air atrium with the waterfall. A nice relaxing feel to it. The only con was the internet service was really slow. Overall, we just love Embassy Suites. The staff was very accomodating. The rate is worth it. Denise from New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “the best birthday memories”
Reviews.Author: pll1209
Reviews.Content: I had at least six or seven birthday partys at this hotel. all of them were amazing and after my friends never stopted telling me how cool it was.they have the best movies and their food is to die for i always get the boneles buffolo wings, there way to good, also the staff are very friendly. they also have an indoor water pool with a hot tub. there a steam room as well. its a great place to stay any time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: JustMy0pini0n
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights during a business trip. The breakfast buffet which includes omelets, pancakes, bacon, fruit, cereal, sausages, biscuits, etc. was a nice touch. To top it off they also offer a Happy Hour with snacks which usually lasts approximate 2 hours in the evening. This is a nice atmosphere to unwind after a busy day. The bartendars are so nice and willing to accomodate you on any drinks that can be made as long as they have the ingredients on the mini bar. The Front Desk and Concierge staff are willing to assist you with any thing to make your stay at the hotel more pleasureable. These employees made my stay even more memorable with the pleasant smiles and lovely attitudes displayed on a daily basis. Hats are off to them for the job they do everyday. The hotel provides a shuttle bus and offers rides within a 5 mile radius of the hotel. No, they do not pick up from DFW airport, this is out of range. There is also a restaurant located on the premises with a friendly bartendar to keep you company.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: larhonda_jordan
Reviews.Content: Great Place to stay, everytime we are in Dallas we stay here. THE rooms are clean, the service is top notch, and to wake up to a full breakfast buffet with cook to order pancakes & omelets Heavenly!!!!!! I highly recommend this hotel, if you want to get your moneys worth this is the place to stay . There is a Sprinkles Cupcakes down the street also .

Reviews.Title: “okay, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: itsy-bitsy-nyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work. Wireless internet is available by the minute or $10 a day. It cut out all the time. A prior reviewer also said the internet was unreliable. The area is boring. There is nothing to do without a car, but there is a Starbucks a few minutes away by car. The hotel has free breakfast including an omelette bar, cereal, fruit, etc. The coffee was prettu good at the hotel. They have a free happy hour. I never ate at the hotel besides breakfast. There is a small gym with some free weights and a few treadmills and ellipticals. Rooms have coffee makers, mini fridges and microwaves.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For a Night Away!”
Reviews.Author: ziegy4me
Reviews.Content: The wife and I took a night away from the kids and booked a room at the Embassy Suites Love Field. The room was very clean, it was spacious, and everything was great. Ordered room service and they were prompt and the food was warm. We didn't try the pool but it looked nice. Excellent breakfast buffet the next morning and then back to the real world. Excellent for a non-holiday refresher!

Reviews.Title: “Cowboys Fans!”
Reviews.Author: dallasfan064
Reviews.Content: We travel to Dallas every year for a Cowboy game - we always stay in an Embassy Suites. This was our first year at Love Field, we read the reviews and liked that it was so close to the stadium and centrally located. The rooms were nice and the breakfast every morning was great. However, the surrounding area is very sketchy! Our car was broken into right outside the front entrance. The Dallas police took a report over the phone and never bothered to come out. The hotels own security guard acknowledged a break in problem. There have been 10 reported car break ins in the past 6 months! Hotel staff not helpful and repeated again and again they are not responsible. I am very disappointed. Not only am I still out the $600 I spent to stay there, I am now out an insurance deductible and about $700 in stolen items. Additionally, I was then charged twice for the same movie that I purchased to entertain my children while dealing with the car rental company, insurance company and the police! The kicker was when they stranded us after the Cowboy game - great Monday night game by the way - because their driver leaves at 12:00 - after taking my money to ensure we would arrive back safely! Will definitely not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Embassy Suites Dallas-Love Field”
Reviews.Author: CincyFamily98
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Dallas Love Field Airport on a recent vaction. The hotel and rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, and was impressed with the size of the bathroom and counter space. The pool was nice. The hotel serves hot made to order breakfast which were very good. There was a lot of variety to choose from. We were a little worried being by one of the runways to the airport, but we didn't hear a thing. The hotel is location is good if you are traveling to downtown to Texas Stadium, downtown Dallas, Plano, and Dallis-Fort Worth Airport. It is about a 35 minute drive to Ft Worth. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms but horrible internet”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Love Field for business. I was supposed to stay 2 nights but had to cut it short 1 night because the internet in the hotel was not working. Apparently this is a re-occurring problem so before you check in to the hotel you may want to verify the internet is working if that is important to you. Otherwise, the rooms have been recently renovated and very nice. The rooms are large with good furnishings and plasma tv in the living room. The bed is very comfortable and the staff is friendly and helpful. The gym is a bit on the small side but functional. I ordered room service and the food was very good and arrived fast. If it wasnt for really bad internet technology at this hotel I would have no problem coming back but I probably wont return as based on reviews this happens allot and frankly for most of us traveling on business we need internet like we need electricity. There really is no excuse for a hotel to have problems with their internet service, its been around long enough that it doesnt qualify as new technology anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy suites okay but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Matty07uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night at short notice and struggled to find a room elsewhere. Hotel has some rennovations underway so a bit of a mess at front and some of the rooms look like they have been trashed, why not pull the curtains if not working in the rooms? Room was fine in terms of size but no hairdryer (only found out in morning and button missing from shower plunger.) Disappointing as room supposed to have been renovated. Breakfast was okay in the morning but Marriott Suites was better. Location not that convenient and Hotel shuttle was booked to take us to Sonny Bryans but dropped us at what must have been a take away, ended up getting a taxi, not easy back to hotel and drove into Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MAFreshair
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Love Field on a business trip for 2 weeks in June and it couldn't have been much better. Free cook to order breakfast, happy hour from 5 to 7 with unlimited free drinks. The room was large and very comfortable, management was extremely polite and accommodating, room service was excellent and reasonably priced. Also, there is a 4 mile running/walking path that goes right from the back of the hotel around a small lake that is very convenient and rather scenic, little bit shabby in parts, but still very nice to have right there. One of the very few drawbacks is that there is sometimes a pretty long wait for the elevators - there are only 2 and in the mornings especially it can be a bit frustrating waiting for one. Overall though definitely an excellent hotel and I highly recommend the Embassy Suites Love Field if you're in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was great”
Reviews.Author: Sista_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I am being kind of liberal with the rating but this hotel had a number of problems. The internet service was down in the hotel for a few days. My rom was way too hot and I had to get maintaineance to come to the room to manually adjust the thermostate. My tv blew out and the tv the hotel brought in showed everything in that bright red and the sound was like people swimming under water. The tv in the bedroom was better but you could not put the tv on mute. The breakfast was the best, however. It was delicious and hot and made to order every morning. The staff was nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “The Embassy Suites Love Field Is Awesome!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wauktown101
Reviews.Content: I do an awful lot of traveling so needless to say, I stay in alot of hotels. I have never stayed in an Embassy Suites Hotel before, but is the rest of them are anything like the Dallas/Love Field hotel, I wouldn't ever recommend any other hotel stay. From now on this hotel line is the one I will always look for and hope that they have one close to where I will be working. I think I wouldn't even mind traveling a bit between my hotel and worksite to stay at an Embassy Suites. From customer service at the front desk, the made to order complimentary breakfast every morning, the 2-hour happy hour every evening with no drink limit, the huge very clean suite with super comfortable bed, and just the overall service was extremely satisfying. I recommend this hotel line to any and everyone. Thanks Embassy Suites. You helped make my entire week in Dallas very easy to be away from home. Patricia

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect. Great for all kinds of Travelers”
Reviews.Author: patitotigre
Reviews.Content: Located just seconds from Dallas Love Field Airport (about 15 minutes Northwest of Downtown), this brand new (or recently renovated) hotel offers it all. Gym, Pool, Food Variety, Great Views, Excellent Service and Free Breakfast and Happy Hour drinks. I recommend this hotel for Business travelers, Small families and retirees. Even though Embassy Suites is tailored more to Business travelers, it does a descent job catering to other types of guests.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the chain”
Reviews.Author: theWimp
Reviews.Content: Whoever runs this hotel knows how to run a hotel. Professional staff, quality construction and comfortable furnishings/bedding make for a great stay. The hotel is one of the older models, but not ancient, so the rooms are larger and quieter than the new ES built nowadays with cheaper materials. HVAC works great and is not noisy, the water is hot and the beds are very comfortable. The free breakfast was excellent. Free parking is close by and convenient if you are in and out of a car all day. The health club looked very well furnished and had lots of eqpt. 2 minor complaints. Only 2 elevators to serve a large hotel, and the TV's are fairly old. This is the only 4 star hotel near Love Field so there are no other options. The closest is the Hilton Park Cities and there's no comparison from a value standpoint. This is by far the better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: dr_mark99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in early May 2007. This is not a particularly fancy hotel, but it was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Even though it is not too far from Love Field and we could see planes landing from our bedroom window, we could not hear them. The hotel also is set back far enough from the road (Northwest Highway) that traffic noise also cannot be heard. The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful. There was an outstanding range of breakfast selections available both cooked to order and buffet included in the price of the room. Room furnishings, particularly the television sets, were a bit dated but that was a minor issue.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get to use all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This would be a great room for a family on vacation. It is a true suite with a living room with a sofa bed and a bedroom. Both rooms have their own TV although the living Tv was an older console model and the bedroom TV was a small TV. The fixtures were all modern and the frig was a nice size and the microwave was a nice touch. I did not get to eat at the restaturaunt, although I wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; free breakfast..free drinks!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and they are making it even nicer. They are currently going through a renovation and the room I was put in was complete. The bedding package was gorgeous and comfortable, the living area was brand new and the bathroom had a curved shower rod. Free cooked to order Breakfast including eggs(any way you want it), bacon, sausage, potatoes pancakes, toast, cereals, fruit, yogurt, pastries....YUM! Evening reception with open bar!!!! for 2 hours. The hotel also has an indoor pool, fitness area, outdoor patio and a beautiful sitting area in the atrium. GREAT VALUE FOR THE PRICE (up to 4ppl in a room and everyone gets the breakfast and drinks)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great amenities, rooms getting tired”
Reviews.Author: dsc434232
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times and always enjoy the friendly check in agent who works late nights - she takes great care of me, remember me from past visits, and is always extra friendly. The location of the hotel is super convenient - with easy access to US-75, IH-35, and the Dallas Tollway - traffic is fairly light on Northwest Highway (where the hotel is located) and there is a grocery store, Walrgeens, Starbucks, and plenty of restaurants close by. The complimentary breakfast is always excellent and the servers keep the tables well cleaned. They added high speed wireless internet in the past few months, but there is a $9.95 fee, plus an additional $5 to borrow a wireless bridge. Basically this negates the value of the free breakfast, but still is a welcome improvement because I had stopped staying at this hotel because of no high speed. My only complaint is that the guest rooms themselves are getting tired - the little things like the wallpaper, alarm clock, carpet, etc. The hotel could use a bit of a facelift, but still is a great value for the money and I'll certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Dallas on business and as usual the stay at the Embassy Suites was excellent. Free cooked to order breakfast and free drinks during "happy hour" in the evening. Even though the hotel is located near the Airport (Love Field) not once did I hear an airplane overhead. Rooms were great would stay here anytime!
